=

er exploring the idea of unit testing and wanting to

d JUnit/TestNG/Agitator/you-name-it, I would

 people can't even agree amongst

eve it's fine and healthy to have differing opinions and believe

nt approaches to developer testing, but I can't help

 not practicing developer testing in

cted is to lower the barriers to entry, to offer a variety of

 suit most tastes and preferences:

 long as you test.

 tools to the table, we should welcome them because we need
